content.question: Two pucks, <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>, with unequal masses, slide with equal speeds in opposite directions on a horizontal surface with negligible friction, as shown in Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. The pucks undergo a head-on collision. After the collision, both pucks move to the right. The speed of Puck <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> has decreased, and the speed of Puck <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> has increased, as shown in Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>. Which of the following is a plausible explanation for the observed behavior of the pucks?

choices.label: The magnitude of change in momentum is the same for each puck, but Puck <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> has more momentum initially.
The magnitude of change in momentum is the same for each puck, but Puck <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> has more momentum initially.
The magnitude of change of momentum is the same for each puck because each puck has the same momentum initially.

The magnitude of change in momentum of Puck <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> is greater than that of Puck <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> because Puck <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> has a greater initial momentum.

The magnitude of change of momentum of Puck <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> is less than that of Puck <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> because Puck <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> has greater mass.

content.answer: The magnitude of change in momentum is the same for each puck, but Puck <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> has more momentum initially.
